title: Pride of Britain Awards: Alexandra Burke appears in gothic gown
text:
She went public with her new boyfriend Angus MacDonald went public back in July, and have been inseparable ever since.

But, Alexandra Burke made a solo appearance at the Pride of Britain Awards held the Grosvenor House Hotel in London on Monday evening as she stepped out in a dramatic gothic gown.

The X Factor star, 31, put on a leggy display in the ensemble, which comprised a tiny black mini dress and a lacy floor-length sheer top layer, boasting cascading ruffles throughout.

Gothic glamour: Alexandra Burke, 31, made a solo appearance at the Pride of Britain Awards held the Grosvenor House Hotel in London on Monday evening

Alexandra showcased her toned pins in the edgy gown, and boosted her height with diamante encrusted stilettos.

She carried her belongings in a tiny black clutch bag and accessorised with statement rings and silver drop-earrings.

The broken heels singer drew attention to her piercing eyes, with a heavy smudge of black eyeliner and lashings of mascara.

Her raven tresses were left pulled back from her face but then left to hang down onto her shoulders.

The X Factor star stepped out in a dramatic gothic gown comprised a tiny black mini dress and a lacy floor-length sheer top layer, boasting cascading ruffles throughout

Happy days: Alexandra's solo outing comes weeks after her boyfriend, and Hull City defender Angus MacDonald, announced he was diagnosed with the early stages of bowel cancer

Alexandra's solo outing comes just weeks after her boyfriend, and Hull City defender, announced he was diagnosed with the early stages of the bowel cancer but was determined to fight it last month.

He posted on his Instagram account at the time, saying the news has come as a 'shock' but that he will be ready to fight this new challenge 'head on.'

He said: 'This is not an easy post to write but life isn't always an easy road to navigate. The news broke today from my club that I have been diagnosed with Bowel Cancer.

'After a year on the sidelines and recently getting back into full training, returning to the pitch felt closer than ever, so this news has come as a complete shock and is hard to take and fully process.

'However, I'm blessed to have fantastic family and friends and some very good people around me to help me get through this, as well as amazing team mates and staff at the club who have been with me all the way through the past year.

'I'm getting my head around this new challenge that lies ahead. I will be ready to fight this head on, and I'm going to do whatever I can to get back to full health and back on that pitch.'

Full of adoration: The Hull City defender has been diagnosed with the early stages of the bowel cancer, with the club confirming news in a statement on behalf of the defender

Loved-up: Earlier this month, Alexandra penned a gushing tribute to Angus, just weeks after he was diagnosed with bowel cancer

Earlier this month, Alexandra penned a gushing tribute on Instragram to Angus, just weeks after his diagnosis, writing: 'You’re so special to me and I adore you' as she shared a slew of loved-up snaps on Instagram.

The Bad Boys hitmaker, who split from her fiancé Josh Ginnelly after three years together earlier this year, publically declared her love to Angus.

Sharing snaps from her birthday, Japan and trip to Disneyland, Alexandra wrote: 'Just a little appreciation post for this amazing man....Thank you for coming into my life and making me constantly smile.

'All we do is laugh and have the most loving time together. You’re so special to me and I adore you. I admire your strength and I admire your passion for life. Never change baby. Counting down the days until I see you...'
